Should I get one without underwire? Log in to post a reply

Any and all comments/experiences are appreciated. I had a lumpectomy and re-excision last summer, chemo, rads, in the fall and winter, now on Tamoxifen.  Am thinking about the bilateral mastectomy with immediate DIEP reconstruction as soon as I pass the 6 month mark for the last radiation. Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2008 06:10AM oldlady wrote: Thanks Vicki!  Although it sounds so discouraging, your experience does help me place my complaint as a "normal" issue.  Now I know not to whine to the docs next time I see them since pain is routine even after all this time. :)
Posts.Title: Pain after a lumpectomy/re-excision? oldlady mamakaren

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2008 08:48PM oldlady wrote: Thanks for all your kind words.  I really don't know what I would have done without this board as support over the last month or so. I will talk to the breast surgeon at the followup regarding cosmetic recon.  He did say on Friday in my groggy post-op haze that if I needed a subsequent re-excision if the margins are still not clear, that it would be time for a mastectomy.  I was so on the fence between the lumpectomy and the mastectomy anyway but all the Tumor Board experts said I was an excellent candidate for lumpectomy so it seemed logical to go with the less-invasive procedure.  Now it seems as if I subjected myself to two unnecessary surgeries if I end up getting a mastectomy anyway. I guess I had barely adjusted to the way the lumpectomy results looked and now I have to readjust.
Posts.Title: Wrong priorities oldlady susan_02143

Posts.Content: oldlady wrote: I am well aware I should be happy that I only had a 2.2 cm mass, that I did not need a full mastectomy, that it was ER/PR + and Her2 Neg. My diagnosis could be so much more serious.  Why then am I getting so upset over the stupid cosmetic stuff? I never was preoccupied with my frontal area before. I was happy I had cleavage. Obviously they served their official purpose when I nursed my 2 kids. But I never dressed to flaunt or minimize that area. They were just part of my body like any other part.  When I had my re-excision 2 days ago, I nearly had a heart attack from the image I saw in the mirror. At my 48 hour mark when I could finally take a shower today, it took me hours to bring myself look again as I didn't want to start bawling again. It looks slightly better than Friday but I feel so deformed. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Wrong priorities oldlady susan_02143

Posts.Content: oldlady wrote: It's been exactly 5 weeks since the lumpectomy/snb (only took out 1 node), 18 days after the re-excision.  Although I am not getting needle-like pains at the actual incisions anymore, there is still fairly constant dull achiness at the overall site.  Is this normal? Lumpectomy ladies, how long did your pain last? Posts.Title: Pain after a lumpectomy/re-excision? oldlady mamakaren

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2008 11:54PM oldlady wrote: Good luck with yours as well!  I never thought there would be an IV version of the lightbulb joke!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy was today oldlady SusanG

Posts.Content: oldlady wrote: All in all, it was okay.  Good: Found out that the HER2/FISH was negative. IIRC, that is good news. Only one lymph node needed to be removed. Bad:  Neither a medical student nor a PA could get an IV line in successfully in either my hand or my lower arm.  They brought in the guy who does the infant and toddler veins. He had no problem in my wrist.  My arm is already turning blue.  2 mam-guided needles were used to mark the spot before I went into surgery.  I was expecting only one needle. For some reason I got a self-pity panic attack and started tearing up after the procedure when the rads were examining the films. I think it was the 3 inch needles sticking out of the site that just set me off. The wound looks huge and ugly.  They used surgical glue instead of stitches. Is that normal?  A lot more tissue is gone than I thought would be missing. I look like a delated tire. Neutral----I got to go home today which means I'm in my own bed and that is good. However, I was released when I was really groggy and really didn't feel ready.  I remember feeling annoyed like this when I had a kid in the driveby delivery era. I didn't like that at all. Really cute--My 4 y.o. niece asked my sister if the docs. had colored my skin all blue.  Apparently she overheard a conversation about the blue dye used for an SNB and she thought they were going to color on my chest. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy was today oldlady SusanG

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 09:03AM oldlady wrote: I had mam-guided needles inserted at either end of the mass to serve as markers during the lumpectomy which immediately followed.  I was pushed in a wheelchair from floor to floor to floor by an orderly.
Posts.Title: breast surgery fuzzypeach CAZ

Posts.Content: oldlady wrote: My oDX score was 18 which correlates to 11% likelihood of reoccurrence.  I am early 40s, ER/PR +, Her2neu -.  Tumor's largest dimension was 2.2 cm and had a Nottingham score of 6.  The ER subscore for the oncotype was 9.2, the PR was 8.4.  When these 2 are added, I get 17.6 which of course rounds up to 18.  I couldn't be more borderline if I tried! :)  In any case, how is the chemo tailored to fit these kind of subscores? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Subscore on oncotype oldlady oldlady

Posts.Content: oldlady wrote: My margins were not clean so I'm going under the knife once again. It will be 4 weeks exactly from the date of the lumpectomy to the date of the re-excision.  11 days out, I am still so bruised and tender, I shrink from just brushing up against something so the idea of them cutting again isn't exactly thrilling.  In any case, for the ladies with unclean margins (haha, I feel as if we were caught doodling in textbooks): What was the amount of time between your lumpectomy and your re-excision?  Were you fully healed from the lumpectomy?  Did it matter if you weren't fully healed? How was the healing from the re-excision as compared to the lumpectomy? And just a general lumpectomy question, when did you start sleeping without a bra? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Experience with re-excision? oldlady oldlady

Posts.Content: oldlady wrote:   I just received the pathology report for my US-guided biopsy which was done a week and a half ago:  Breast, Right, Sono-guided Biopsy: Tumor type: Infiltrating ductal carcinoma, no special type. Nottingham Grade: Well-differentiated (G1) Nottinghan Score 5/9 (Tubules=2, Nuclei=2, Mitoses=1; Mitotic Count 2 per 10 HPV at 40x power) Tumor Necrosis: Present in DCIS Venous/Lymphatic Invasion: Absent Estrogen Receptors: Positive (100% Nuclear Staining) Progesterone Receptors: Positive (100% Nuclear Staining) HER2 by immunohistochemistry: Equivocal (2+) HER2 by FISH: pending ______ Additional pathological changes: Ductal Carcinoma In-situ, cribriform and solid types with necrosis,  nuclear grade 3 Anyone want to help translate? Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2008 09:59AM oldlady wrote: I was told a fronthook wireless bra would suffice after a lumpectomy.  Macy's didn't have any but I finally found some at JC Penney of all places.  They had sport bras with zippers that looked comfortable but some ladies on here say the bottom where the zipper initially connects can dig into your chest. I bought a Playtex 18 hour bra with padded straps. It has about 6 hooks in the front.  It looks and feels very strong and sturdy and it definitely holds things in place
